text: Every Idaho distributor, winery, and wine direct shipper must file
label: BODY

text: a monthly wine tax return.  This return is due on the 15th of the
label: BODY

text: month immediately following the tax period.  Round figures to
label: BODY

text: the nearest whole gallon on all forms.
label: HH3

text: You must file a return even if you don't owe any tax for
label: HH3

text: the period.  You must sign your return to make it valid.
label: HH3

text: Unsigned returns may result in penalty or interest, or both.
label: HH3

text: Include your title, the date, and phone number of your business.
label: BODY

text: Verify your identification information on the form.  Draw a line
label: BODY

text: through any errors and write in the correct information.  If you've
label: BODY

text: made changes, mark the "Address Change" box.  Check the
label: BODY

text: "Cancel Permit" box if you want to cancel your Idaho wine tax
label: BODY

text: permit.
label: BODY

text: DISTRIBUTORS - Complete Form 1752 and all schedules that
label: BODY

text: apply.
label: BODY

text: WINERIES - Complete Form 1752 (lines 8 - 19b).  Also complete
label: BODY

text: Forms WI 1722, WI 1723, WI 1724, and (if used)
label: BODY

text: DIRECT SHIPPERS - Complete Form 1752 (lines 8 and
label: BODY

text: 14 - 19b).  No schedules are required if you are a direct shipper
label: BODY

text: only.
label: BODY

text: REPORTING PERMIT NUMBERS - Forms WI 1721 and
label: BODY

text: WI 1722 require that you use "reporting permit numbers."  If you
label: BODY

text: don't list the reporting permit number of the vendors you have
label: BODY

text: purchased from, you are acting as your own importer.  List the
label: BODY

text: vendor name and vendor invoice date and number, but insert
label: BODY

text: your own reporting permit numer.
label: BODY

text: EXTRA SCHEDULES - If you need extra schedules, you can
label: BODY

text: print copies from our Web site at tax.idaho.gov (click on
label: BODY

text: "Forms," then "Miscellaneous Idaho Forms"), or call us at
label: BODY

text: 334-7660 in the Boise area or (800) 972-7660 toll free.
label: BODY

text: FORM 1752 WINE TAX RETURN
label: HH2

text: Accountable Gallons
label: HH3

text: Distributors complete lines 1-7.  Wineries and direct shippers
label: BODY

text: begin on line 8.
label: BODY

text: Line 1.
label: HH3

text: Beginning inventory.  This should be the ending inven­
label: BODY

text: tory from the previous tax month.
label: BODY

text: Line 2.  	 Total purchases.  Complete Form WI 1721 and enter
label: HH3

text: the amount from the last page, line 20.
label: BODY

text: Line 3.
label: HH3

text: Add lines 1 and 2.
label: BODY

text: Line 4.  	 Ending inventory.  Take a physical count of your wine
label: HH3

text: inventory at the end of the last working day of the tax
label: BODY

text: period. Enter the total gallons on hand on this line.
label: BODY

text: FORM 1752 INSTRUCTIONS
label: BODY

text: Idaho Wine Distributors, Wineries, and Wine Direct Shippers Tax Return
label: HH1

text: Line 5.  	 Spoilage.  You can deduct up to .75% (.0075) of total
label: BODY

text: purchases (line 2) without attaching documenta­
label: BODY

text: tion.  Claim actual spoilage only.  If your spoilage
label: BODY

text: exceeds .75% of line 2, you must attach proof such
label: BODY

text: as copies of insurance claims, police reports, or forms
label: BODY

text: confirming destruction witnessed by a Tax Commis­
label: BODY

text: sion employee.
label: BODY

text: Line 6.  	 Total deductions.   Add lines 4 and 5.
label: BODY

text: Line 7.  	 Total taxable gallons.  Subtract line 6 from line 3.
label: BODY

text: Line 8.  	 WINERIES AND DIRECT SHIPPERS.  Begin here.
label: BODY

text: Check the box and enter total gallons sold.  Distribu­
label: BODY

text: tors do not use this line.
label: BODY

text: Breweries manufacturing strong beer are defined as
label: BODY

text: wineries (Strong beer is beer with alcohol content
label: BODY

text: over 4% by weight.)
label: BODY

text: Exemptions - Distributors And Wineries Only
label: BODY

text: Line 9.  	 Sales/Transfers to Idaho distributors.  Complete Form WI
label: BODY

text: 1722 and enter the total from the last page, line 20.
label: BODY

text: Line 10. 	 Sales/Transfers to out-of-state distributors.  Complete
label: BODY

text: Form WI 1723 and enter the total from the last page,
label: BODY

text: line 20.
label: BODY

text: Line 11.
label: BODY

text: Sales to military or liquor dispensaries.  Complete
label: BODY

text: Form WI 1724 and enter the total from the last page,
label: BODY

text: line 20.
label: BODY

text: Line 12.  	 Other exempt sales or transactions.  If you enter an
label: BODY

text: amount here, you must attach copies of your invoices
label: BODY

text: and a complete	explanation.
label: BODY

text: Line 13.	 Total exemptions.  Add lines 9, 10, 11, and 12.
label: BODY

text: Tax Computation
label: BODY

text: Line 14.	 Total taxable gallons.  Follow the instructions provided
label: BODY

text: on the return.
label: BODY

text: Line 15.	 Tax due or [refund].  Multiply line 14 by the tax rate
label: BODY

text: ($.45).  If the amount reflects a refund, insert the
label: BODY

text: figure in [brackets].
label: BODY

text: Line 16.	 Credit from previous periods.  If you've received a let­
label: BODY

text: ter from the Tax Commission telling you that you have
label: BODY

text: a credit due from a previous tax period and you want
label: BODY

text: to use that credit on this return, attach the letter to this
label: BODY

text: return and enter the amount to be applied.
label: BODY

text: Line 17.	 Total tax due or [refund].  Subtract line 16 from
label: BODY

text: line 15.
label: BODY

text: Line 18.	 Penalty.  You must file and pay by the due date listed
label: HH2

text: on the tax return. If you don't, the following penalties
label: BODY

text: apply:
label: BODY

text: If you file on time but your payment is late, the
label: BODY

text: penalty is 0.5% of the tax due (see line 17) for each
label: BODY

text: late month. This penalty begins the first day you are
label: BODY

text: late and continues until you pay the tax.
label: BODY

text: If you file late, the penalty is 5% of the tax due
label: BODY

text: (see line 17) for each late month. This penalty begins
label: BODY

text: the first day you are late and continues until you file
label: BODY

text: your return or pay the tax.
label: BODY

text: If you file late and don't pay the tax when you
label: BODY

text: file, there is an additional late penalty of 0.5% of the
label: BODY

text: tax due (see line 17) for each late month. This pen­
label: BODY

text: alty begins the day after you file the late return until
label: BODY

text: you pay the tax.
label: BODY

text: Note: No penalty is due if no tax is due. The mini­
label: HH3

text: mum penalty amount is $10, and the maximum
label: BODY

text: penalty is 25%. Even if your payment is only one day
label: BODY

text: late, you still owe the entire monthly penalty.
label: BODY

text: Interest.  Interest accrues on late payments from the
label: HH3

text: due date until paid.  Rates are as follows:
label: BODY

text: Line 19a.	 Total due - Add lines 17 and 18.  ATTACH PAYMENT
label: HH2

text: FOR AMOUNT DUE.
label: BODY

text: Line 19b.	 Total refund - If the amount on line 17 is a refund, we'll
label: HH3

text: send you a check.
label: BODY

text: FORM WI 1721 WINE PURCHASES
label: HH3

text: Only distributors complete this form.  Wineries do not use this
label: BODY

text: form.
label: BODY

text: Enter the purchases you've made during the month from manu­
label: BODY

text: facturers, importers, and other distributors.
label: BODY

text: For each vendor invoice, you must enter the vendor name, re­
label: BODY

text: porting permit number (see instructions), the invoice date on the
label: BODY

text: vendor's invoice, the vendor invoice number (don't use your own
label: BODY

text: purchase order or check number), and the amount purchased.
label: BODY

text: (Remember - if you are your own importer, insert your reporting
label: BODY

text: permit number.)
label: BODY

text: See specific instructions on Form WI 1721.
label: BODY

text: FORM WI 1722 SALES/TRANSFERS TO IDAHO
label: HH3

text: DISTRIBUTORS
label: HH3

text: Distributors and wineries complete this form.
label: BODY

text: Enter the sales or transfers you've made during the month to
label: BODY

text: distributors located in Idaho.  For each sales invoice, enter the
label: BODY

text: customer's name and reporting permit number, your invoice date,
label: BODY

text: and your invoice number.  Use as many pages as you need to
label: BODY

text: report all sales and transfers.
label: BODY

text: See the specific instructions on Form WI 1722.
label: BODY

text: FORM WI 1723 SALES/TRANSFERS TO OUT-OF-STATE
label: BODY

text: DISTRIBUTORS
label: HH3

text: TORS
label: H4

text: Distributors and wineries complete this form.
label: BODY

text: Enter the sales or transfers you've made during the month to
label: BODY

text: distributors located in states other than Idaho.  For each sales
label: BODY

text: invoice, enter the customer's name, city and state, and your
label: BODY

text: invoice date and number.  Use as many pages as you need to
label: BODY

text: report all sales and transfers.
label: BODY

text: See the specific instructions on Form WI 1723.
label: BODY

text: FORM WI 1724 SALES TO MILITARY AND LIQUOR
label: BODY

text: DISPENSARIES
label: H3

text: Distributors and wineries complete this form.
label: BODY

text: FORM WI 1725 ODD SIZED PACKAGES -
label: BODY

text: CONVERSION
label: H3

text: Use this form only if you're reporting by packages in columns
label: BODY

text: 2 through 18 on the previous forms discussed, and there's no
label: BODY

text: column provided for one of the package sizes on the invoice.
label: BODY

text: After converting the item to gallons, carry the total gallons of the
label: BODY

text: odd-sized packages for that invoice back to the appropriate line
label: BODY

text: of the form for which you were required to make the conversion.
label: BODY

text: Amended returns.  Use this form to amend a wine return.
label: BODY

text: Check the "AMENDED RETURN" box  at the top of the form.
label: BODY

text: If you didn't keep a copy of the original return, contact the Tax
label: BODY

text: Commission for one.  Complete the entire form using the correct
label: BODY

text: amounts.  Don't enter the net change.
label: BODY

text: Taxes to be paid by electronic funds transfer.  All taxes due
label: BODY

text: to the State of Idaho must be paid by electronic funds transfer
label: BODY

text: whenever the amount due is $100,000 or greater.  You must file
label: BODY

text: your written tax return on or before the due date indicating pay­
label: BODY

text: ment by Electronic Funds Transfer.
label: BODY

text: If you are not required to pay by electronic funds transfer, the total
label: BODY

text: payment for tax due must accompany your return.  Make your
label: BODY

text: check or money order payable to the State Tax Commission.  Do
label: BODY

text: not staple your check to your return or send a check stub.
label: BODY

text: Payment by credit/debit card and e-check.  You can use a
label: BODY

text: credit/debit card or e-check to make payments under $100,000
label: BODY

text: to the state of Idaho.  You can pay through our web site at
label: BODY

text: tax.idaho.gov.  We accept American Express, Discover,
label: BODY

text: MasterCard, and Visa for credit card payments.  A convenience
label: BODY

text: fee is added to all credit/debit card and e-check payments
label: BODY

text: (effective January 1, 2009).
label: BODY

text: Mail return to:  Idaho State Tax Commission, PO Box 76, Boise ID 83707-0076
label: HH1

text: FORM 1752 INSTRUCTIONS -- continued
label: BODY
